author: heroindes
title: Play-to-Earn NFT Football game
description: Еще не было связи между блокчейном и повседневной игрой/занятиями спортом.

f6_assessments.q0:
One of the fantastic ideas that connect physical life with the blockchain network, this idea is about football the popular game that everyone in the world knows. The team wants to make a game that when physically playing football with their smart ball, you will earn tokens. 
But sadly, the team just has only the brief about the game is and nothing else to prove that this game will bring value to Cardano ecosystem. Even they note about the potential future, but there is no plan, that future is nonsense.
f6_assessments.q1:
Besides the idea brief and the potential vision of the game, the team also provides the roadmap but it's too short and unclear. With few sentences, that roadmap cannot explain what the team will do and will get in each period of time inside the roadmap. 
To produce an NFT game, especially a physical NFT game like them, they have to prepare a lot of activities that are not just coding, designing... but also about marketing, community activities... 
So, to me. This team has no ability to make this game come true as they propose.
f6_assessments.q2:
We can't audit this proposal because there is nothing for it. Because the roadmap is nonsense without a plan, and there is no key metrics. 
Info for the team, after funding, the team has to report regularly to Catalyst their progress, hence, the team must provide a roadmap and key metrics for CA/ vCA assessments that are available to audit their idea. The more detail in the roadmap the easier on audit and we love it more than a roadmap with just a few headlines without detail. Or the team can explain more about the roadmap in another part of the proposal then just summary it again. Of course, the key metrics must be fitted with the challenge given as first, if not it's failed from impact assessment. 
One more thing is the team must describe how they are aware of the problem context by detailed explaining it, then detailing the solution that must address those problems. If not, it will be hard for everyone to understand what the team wants to do and is it helpful or not. This means the proposal can get a low scoring in all three-part: impact, feasibility, auditability.

f6_assessments.q0:
This game is within the challenge, and the proposal also shows that this game will have a big impact on Cardano ecosystem. 
But it doesn't have any key metrics or goals to show that the game developer considers the challenge setting.
f6_assessments.q1:
This proposal has only: 
- A simple brief about the future vision of the game 
- A simple roadmap that can't help to understand what they will do and finish. 
There is lacking all basic things for assessing the feasibility. Include: 
- Detail implementation plan with a detailed explanation about features, actions, activities of their plan. This will help to assess all other parts in the proposal are suitable or not. 
- Detailed budget that should be pointed which/ who it will be used for. Based on the plan, it will be assessed reasonable or not to be funded and help voters make decisions on voting. 
Not just those info only, for more trust the proposal must have: 
- Team info with background or ability, and which roles they are working for in this proposal
- Some relevant risks and how the team will face them. To me, it helps to assess that the team has a well-preparation for their plan. 
And for getting the perfect score of feasibility, the proposal should attach some MVP, samples, evidence, resource... that the team is already done or on going doing it.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal doesn't have the basic things for auditing, including: 
- Roadmap with detail and realistic timeline. More detail will help Catalyst team easier on track and check the project regularly, currently, the project team has to report in biweek. 
-> The roadmap in the proposal is too short! 
- Key metrics that are clear and fittable with the plan and vision of the team, of course, must be aligned with the challenge setting.
-> This proposal doesn't have any key metric for measuring success. 

And 2 explanation to help Catalyst team easy understand what the proposal want to do: 
- Problem explanation, should be in case of studies, the context that the team has been aware and motivated to make the proposal.
- Solution explanation, to explain detail about how the solution can help to solve the problem. 
-> For gaming, it should be a game mechanic, marketing plan, or special activities in-game that attract players effectively...

f6_assessments.q0:
FIFA estimates that a staggering 265 million people – men and women – play football worldwide, and a staggering 3.5 billion consider themselves football fans. Hence if this project succeeds, it will make a huge user of the Cardano system. 
The proposer also points out how this game will affect the Cardano ecosystem in the proposal. 
Unfortunately, the proposer doesn't provide any key metrics to show that this game aligns with the challenge setting.
f6_assessments.q1:
The idea is good but it will be complex to do. But the proposer has no content about the plan for making this game.
Even there is no explanation about the game mechanic, materials... and technical things for developing the game. 
The proposer outlined the roadmap and there is some completed step but it cannot be used for tracking and assessing their feasibility. 
There is also no proof about what they did and referral links or evidence for that. Even the info of the proposer is not there to help we ask, then help them improve the plan.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposer does not provide enough info that's sufficient to audit the progress and the success of this project. He has no detailed roadmap, and no key metrics, they're the basic things for auditing the project. 
Moreover, because the content in the proposal is poorly - just about introduction the game idea. So I can't understand in detail the problem that the proposer wants to solve and solution can address it or not. Of course, there is no risk management that be included in this proposal also.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal creates an IoT ball and players will get crypto when playing and practicing with it.
Players will be able to actively engage in a physical game, as opposed to more passive forms of entertainment. This alternative would be more beneficial to players' health and psychology.
f6_assessments.q1:
You mentioned that your team consists of many IoT experts, programmers, however, I can't find your team's contact information.
The road map is too sketchy, a lot of information has not been described. Based on the road map, in Q3 2019, the first prototype version of the IoT ball was completed, however I did not find any pictures or information of it.
The experience and plan mentioned are not enough, I think this project will not be possible if you do not provide the necessary information.
f6_assessments.q2:
This is a very good idea, players can actively play a physical game, as opposed to conventional forms of entertainment. However, I am disappointed that the information provided is incomplete.
First, this is an IoT ball, players who want to own it have to spend some money to buy it, I think it's not cheap. How does the calculation of force, trajectory, speed take place?
Next, should add information and pictures about the ball. I tried searching but couldn't find any information about this ball.
There needs to be a way to attract players to the IoT ball, for example: organizing seminars, presentations, advertising,...
Requires a budget of $ 60000, specifically how this money is used?
What is the expected KPI?

solution: Мы создадим первую физическую футбольную игру NFT с использованием нашего запатентованного IoT-мяча.
experience: Наша команда состоит из опытных экспертов в области IoT, программистов и провидцев.
